item.title: The Power of Subtractive Thinking
item.description: What’s better: more success or less failure? More possibilities or less impossibilities? Let’s take a look at the seemingly pointless question—and discover the surprising answer.

item.title: Who Has the Ressources to Innovate in Times of Transformation?
item.description: The media industry is in the throes of its biggest transformation yet. And on top, public service media is supposed to be innovative, too. What seems like asking too much, might be a blessing in disguise.

item.title: A Visualization of Leadership
item.description: Recently, I came across a helpful visualization of what Leadership means in times of Digital Transformation. Let me show you.

item.title: The Best of Both VUCAs
item.description: Ever heard of VUCA—as in: Volatility, Uncertainty, Complexity, and Ambiguity? Ever thought that these aspects could actually be beneficial on a certain level? Let’s find out.

item.title: Being Productively Creative---Artist vs. Designer
item.description: Have you ever experienced “writer’s block” or “masterpiece syndrome?” Here’s some advice on how to frame your mind, get into problem solving and be productively creative.

item.title: Applying Design Thinking to a Pandemic
item.description: Everybody seems to have strong opinions about the best way to get out of the COVID-19 pandemic—to the point that makes it really tough to, indeed, get out. Maybe Design Thinking can help?

item.title: IOOI: Put Purpose to Work
item.description: We live in times of volatility, uncertainty, complexity, and ambiguity. Let’s take a closer look at a framework called IOOI that can help bring a sense of purpose to your work.

item.title: Are We Innovating Our Stagnation?
item.description: Today’s global challenges require humankind to learn and adapt. Artificial Intelligence will help driving these changes, right?—Maybe not.

item.title: Improving Your Chances with Non-Negotiables
item.description: Your chances of winning any game improve drastically once you learn the rules. But what if there aren’t any clear rules? Non-Negotiables are here to help.

item.title: Test Your Way to Success
item.description: Ever spent too much time on something that turned out to be based on the wrong assumptions? Here’s how to make sure that you’re investing your time correctly.

item.title: The Antiquated Form of the World’s Most Innovative Companies
item.description: Adults regularly vote on the most important matters of government—yet at work, they accept having usually little to no decision-making power. How come?
